metadata.title: CVE-2023-52502 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:nfc: fix races in nfc_llcp_sock_get() and nfc_llcp_sock_get_sn() Sili Luoreported a race in nfc_llcp_sock_get(), leading to UAF. Getting a referenceon the socket found in a lookup while holding a lock should happen beforereleasing the lock. nfc_llcp_sock_get_sn() has a similar problem. Finallynfc_llcp_recv_snl() needs to make sure the socket found bynfc_llcp_sock_from_sn() does not disappear.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52502` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-231-generic - 4.15.0-231.243~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-231-generic - 4.15.0-231.243~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-231-lowlatency - 4.15.0-231.243~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1175-aws - 4.15.0-1175.188~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1183-azure - 4.15.0-1183.198~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1168-gcp - 4.15.0-1168.185~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-261.295').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-231.243~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1139.149').
linux-aws package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1176.191').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1175.188~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1183.198~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1107.114').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1168.185~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1137.148~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
